title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation in Agriculture and Food Safety Between Denmark and Indonesia, Phase I

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Food aims support a sustainable development of the dairy sector in Indonesia and improving food safety and hygiene in the value chain and feed quality for the cattle through:
-An Overview of the organic dairy value chain concerning management and control -Improved legal framework and practices concerning production of organic dairy products covering the entire value chain -Improved Good Veterinary Practices focused on the organic system. -Increased capacity of central and regional government officials in the area of risk-based feed and food safety management and control -A plan and appointment for implementation of organic dairy legislation in a pilot farm in East Java created.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Food is a peer-to-peer cooperation between Danish Veterinary and Food Administration and the Indonesian Ministry of Agriculture. Through the project, the Indonesian Ministry will improve food safety and hygiene in the value chain and feed quality for the cattle.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.

title.narrative: Not applicable as baseline, impact indicators are not defined for current SSC projects.
